item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/07/22/trying-ingress/#comment-4238">Jay Willis</a>.
I saw a few people mention that. I still don't know what an anomaly event actually is. If you come up definitely let me know.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jay Willis.

I saw a few people mention that. I still don’t know what an anomaly event actually is. If you come up definitely let me know.

item.title: By: Jay Willis
item.dc:creator: Jay Willis
item.description: Well, a bunch of nerdy types are going to overrun SLC soon. An Ingress Anomaly is scheduled for Oct 18th. https://plus.google.com/u/0/events/cjaroqscb6bdp3c9v4h21bom8jk I might come up to play, working on transportation now.
item.content:encoded: Well, a bunch of nerdy types are going to overrun SLC soon. An Ingress Anomaly is scheduled for Oct 18th. https://plus.google.com/u/0/events/cjaroqscb6bdp3c9v4h21bom8jk I might come up to play, working on transportation now.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/07/22/trying-ingress/#comment-4236">Jay Willis</a>.
Haha, no, I went with: j9t
My choice of teams was based purely on the number of green vs. blue portals I saw around my neighborhood. I wanted an opportunity to attack stuff without having to walk too far.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jay Willis.

Haha, no, I went with: j9t

My choice of teams was based purely on the number of green vs. blue portals I saw around my neighborhood. I wanted an opportunity to attack stuff without having to walk too far.

item.title: By: Jay Willis
item.dc:creator: Jay Willis
item.description: Hey, so is your agent name "stilts"? I have been playing since December and am currently waiting for one more badge for level 14. I have met so many great people playing this game, if it really is a game. I would have pegged you as Enlightened though. Btw, "thejoker" was already taken so I became "rekojeht".
item.content:encoded: Hey, so is your agent name “stilts”? I have been playing since December and am currently waiting for one more badge for level 14. I have met so many great people playing this game, if it really is a game. I would have pegged you as Enlightened though. Btw, “thejoker” was already taken so I became “rekojeht”.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/07/22/trying-ingress/#comment-4234">Lorelle</a>.
I've recruited a few near by in-laws to help with some local portals :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lorelle.

I’ve recruited a few near by in-laws to help with some local portals ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Lorelle
item.dc:creator: Lorelle
item.description:
Excellent! If you need some help just let me know. I'm level 10 and my husband's level 11 and we've been playing It all over the world in our travels. It's a game that changes your playing over time so don't treat your initial experience as the summary of the game. As you play, most people focus on the points in the levels, but if you focus on the badges you will automatically level up and accumulate the points you need. As you play, the game shifts and changes but only in your mind, which is why it is so popular for intellectuals. It also has a fantastic community so I encourage you to join your local Ingress Google+ group and expand the possibilities as it is a highly social game and it's very hard to accomplish much without other players.
Have fun and welcome to Ingress.
And I highly recommend a really good battery pack for two. There are some ways to reduce the battery drain like turning off the sound and turning off notifications and lowering the light level.
item.content:encoded:
Excellent! If you need some help just let me know. I’m level 10 and my husband’s level 11 and we’ve been playing It all over the world in our travels. It’s a game that changes your playing over time so don’t treat your initial experience as the summary of the game. As you play, most people focus on the points in the levels, but if you focus on the badges you will automatically level up and accumulate the points you need. As you play, the game shifts and changes but only in your mind, which is why it is so popular for intellectuals. It also has a fantastic community so I encourage you to join your local Ingress Google+ group and expand the possibilities as it is a highly social game and it’s very hard to accomplish much without other players.

Have fun and welcome to Ingress.

And I highly recommend a really good battery pack for two. There are some ways to reduce the battery drain like turning off the sound and turning off notifications and lowering the light level.
